content:
• Monday, June 11, 2018
  • MVIS

    MicroVision -1.6% on secondary offering

    • MicroVision (NASDAQ:MVIS) is 1.6% lower after hours following the announcement of a secondary share offering.
    • Terms weren't disclosed, but Ladenburg Thalmann will be sole book-running manager.
    • The underwriters are expected to get a 30-day option to buy up to 15% more shares at the offering price. Net proceeds are set for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • HTGC

    Hercules Capital -2.6% on offering said to come at $12.15/share

    • Hercules Capital (NASDAQ:HTGC) has fallen further after hours, down 2.6%, on word from Bloomberg that the company's 6M-share offering is coming at $12.15/share.
    • The stock had dipped slightly postmarket after announcing the offering, which includes a greenshoe option. They're now trading at $12.08.
    • Shares are down 5.5% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM | 7 Comments
  • HOME

    At Home Group -2% on 8M-share secondary offering

    • At Home Group (NASDAQ:HOME) is 2% lower after announcing a secondary offering of 8M shares for selling stockholders.
    • Those shares, from affiliates of AEA Investors and Starr Investment Holdings, are set to offer at $37.90-$38.10 each, Bloomberg reports, a 0.9%-$1.5% discount from close.
    • Underwriters will get a 30-day option to buy up to 1.2M more shares at the offering price.
    • BofA Merrill Lynch is leading the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM

  • AcelRx +4.1% after Cantor Fitzgerald starts at Overweight

    • AcelRx is up 4.1% after hours, shortly after getting an initiation by Cantor Fitzgerald at Overweight.
    • The firm set its price target to $6, implying 64% upside from today's close of $3.65.
    • AcelRX is up 80.3% YTD after gaining 71.8% this quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power +12% on Audi contract extension

    • Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) +12.2% after-hours on news it signed a three-and-a-half-year extension to its technology solutions contract for fuel cell passenger cars with Audi.
    • BLDP expects the contract extension to be valued at C$80M-C$130M, supporting Audi through its small series production launch.
    • BLDP's HyMotion program encompasses automotive fuel cell stack development as well as system design support activities.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 44 Comments
  • ATVI

    Baird restates bullish videogame take on cusp of E3

    • With industry trade show E3 ramping up for an official start tomorrow, Baird is bullish on videogame makers that it says aren't short on growth drivers.
    • It's a "must own" sector, analyst Colin Sebastian says, "on track to become the largest segment of media and entertainment globally" as it runs toward $145B in revenue by 2020.
    • "We expect multiple catalysts to drive continued growth and profitability gains for top 'pure-play' publishers including Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI), EA (NASDAQ:EA), Ubisoft (OTCPK:UBSFY) and Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO)," he writes.
    • He's reiterating Outperform ratings on ATVI, EA and TTWO. Key catalysts ahead: digital downloads, microtransactions, esports, mobile, and streaming/cloud services -- along with a new generation of consoles expected in 2020 or 2021.
    • In today's market action: ATVI +1%; EA +0.9%; TTWO -0.1%; OTCPK:UBSFY +1.6%; SNE +1.1%; MSFT -0.6%; OTCPK:NTDOY +0.2%; GAMR -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 15 Comments
  • RH

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/11/2018)

    • Top gainers: RH +19.0%. PLAY +14.0%. URBN +5.3%. KMG +4.2%. ACRX +4.3%.
    • Top Losers: JCAP -6.3%. IMMU -4.9%.  HTGC -2.7%. PSTG -1.9%. ITCB -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics files for mixed shelf offering; shares down 6% after hours

    • Nano cap Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) slips 6% after hours on the heels of its filing of a prospectus for an unspecified mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • PFNX

    Pfenex out-licenses lead candidate PF708 in U.S. for $27.5M plus cut of gross profit; shares up 5% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap Pfenex (NYSEMKT:PFNX) is up 5% after hours on average volume in response to its deal with Alvogen for exclusive U.S. commercialization rights to PF708, a proposed biosimilar of Eli Lilly's (NYSE:LLY) Forteo [teriparatide (rDNA origin) injection].
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Pfenex will receive $2.5M upfront, up to $25M in support and regulatory milestones and 50% of the gross profit from commercial sales if PF708 is rated as Therapeutic Equivalent to Forteo and up to 40% if rated differently.
    • Pfenex says it expects to submit its U.S. marketing application next quarter with commercial launch to commence as early as Q3 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters updates on Q1 sales

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) rallies after disclosing that Q2 comparable retail segment sales rose in the mid-teens range.
    • SEC 10-Q filing
    • URBN +4.21% AH to $49.00. Shares of Urban Outfitters were up 1.29% during the normal trading session before the SEC filing dropped.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • RH

    RH sets guidance ahead of expectations

    • Shares of RH (NYSE:RH) shoot up 13.4% in AH trading after the company sets pleasing guidance.
    • RH sees FY19 revenue of $2.53B tp $2.57B vs. $2.55B and FY19 EPS of $6.34 to $6.83 vs. $5.98 consensus. Q2 guidance was also released by RH ahead of expectations.
    • "Our work this past year to consolidate our distribution center network from four facilities to two while streamlining operations throughout our supply chain, has resulted in a significantly more efficient cost and working capital model.," notes RH management.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • PLAY

    Dave & Buster's up 18% after earnings

    • Dave & Buster's Entertainment (NASDAQ:PLAY) reports comparable sales fell 4.9% in Q1 vs. -5.7% consensus estimate. Total sales were 9.2% higher as new stores contributed.
    • Adjusted EBITDA was up 0.4% to $95.9M. As a percentage of sales, adjusted EBITDA came in at 28.9% vs. 31.4% a year ago.
    • Operating income as a percentage of sales fell 350 basis points to 17.6%.
    • D&B development update: "In fiscal 2018, we are on track to open 14 to 15 new stores, representing 13% to 14% unit growth. At the top end of the range, these store openings include 11 large, two small and two 17K format stores, and will skew towards new markets for our brand. We currently have five stores under construction."
    • D&B FY18 guidance: Total revenues of $1.20B to $1.24B vs. $1.23B consensus, comparable store sales decrease in the low-to-mid single digits, net income of $95M to $110M.
    • PLAY +18.17% AH to $56.51.
    • Previously: Dave & Buster's beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (June 11)
    • Previously: Dave & Buster's CEO to step down (June 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • KMG

    KMG Chemicals beats by $0.26, beats on revenue

    • KMG Chemicals (NYSE:KMG): Q3 EPS of $1.10 beats by $0.26.
    • Revenue of $118.65M (+45.4% Y/Y) beats by $5.68M.
    • Shares +3.96%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • RH

    RH beats by $0.31, misses on revenue

    • RH (NYSE:RH): Q1 EPS of $1.33 beats by $0.31.
    • Revenue of $557.4M (-0.8% Y/Y) misses by $5.76M.
    • Shares +9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 31 Comments
  • PLAY

    Dave & Buster's beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Dave & Buster's (NASDAQ:PLAY): Q1 EPS of $1.04 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $332.19M (+9.2% Y/Y) beats by $10.14M.
    • Shares +11.23%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • KDMN

    Kadmon readies stock offering; shares down 1% after hours

    • Kadmon Holdings (NYSE:KDMN) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • COP

    Lots of reasons to like ConocoPhillips, BMO analysts say in Outperform rating

    • ConocoPhillips (COP +1.7%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and $78 stock price target at BMO Capital, which cites several encouraging company-specific tailwinds and favorable industry-wide dynamics.
    • Among BMO's bullish factors working in favor of COP are expectations for robust free cash flow of $6.4B in 2018 and $6.3B in 2019, the likelihood of increased stock buybacks and dividend growth through at least 2022, and 70% of the company's production is tied to Brent crude which gives COP better exposure vs. the 30% average for large cap peers.
    • COP also boasts on the best Bakken positions when considering its scale and productivity, its liquefied natural gas and oil sands assets should enjoy stable production over the coming years and generate meaningful free cash flow, and the stock looks attractive based on multiple metrics such as dividend yield, EV/EBITDA, P/E, price/cash flow and free cash flow yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 8 Comments
  • APA

    Apache +6% as Argus upgrades to Buy on strong Permian commitment

    • Apache (APA +6%) surges after Argus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $56 price target, citing the company's strategy of allocating nearly 70% of its FY 2018 capital spending program to production in the Permian Basin, as well as the firm's expectations for rising crude oil prices.
    • APA intends to operate 13-15 rigs in the Permian this year, likely leading to stronger earnings growth, which Argus forecasts at $1.60/share vs. its earlier outlook for FY 2018 EPS of $1.30.
    • On valuation, APA trades below the peer average for enterprise value/EBITDA, enterprise value/total reserves and price/cash flow, Argus says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENDP

    Endo settles all TRT liability claims; shares up 6%

    • Endo International (ENDP +5.8%) is up on modestly higher volume on the heels of its announcement that it has executed a master settlement agreement resolving all known product liability claims against it related to testosterone replacement therapy (TRT).
    • The company will make a one-time deposit into a settlement fund after which participating claimants will release their claims. The payment will not increase its product liability reserve because an accrual was already recorded.
    • Previously: Endo International prevails in Testim liability case (Nov. 16, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 10 Comments
  • UEC

    Uranium Energy reports FQ3 net loss, issues going-concern warning

    • Uranium Energy (UEC -2.3%) is lower after reporting a FQ3 net loss of $0.03/share, the same as the prior-year quarter, with no revenues and no expectations for generating taxable income during FY 2018.
    • UEC says it finished the period with $7.36M in working capital vs. $21.1M at the end of FY 2017, with "substantial doubt" it has enough cash and short-term investments to continue as a going concern for the next 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 5 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos completes sale of its Public Safety & Security Division

    • Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) completes the previously announced sale of its Public Safety & Security Division to Securitas Electronic Security.
    • At the close of the transaction, Kratos received $70.7M in cash, subject to a working cash adjustment. 
    • Kratos expects to end up with $70M in net cash proceeds, net related transaction expenses. 
    • Kratos shares are up 0.3% to $11.75. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • NNDM

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/11/2018)

    • Gainers: NNDM +114%. RFIL +40%. IGLD +26%. FIT +17%. HMI +14%.
    • Losers: CASA -10%. GRVY -10%. MGIC -8%. BCOR -8%. AAOI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar defended at Baird, citing comfort in revenue visibility

    • First Solar (FSLR -2%) extends its 25% swoon following an eight-session losing streak, despite favorable comments from Baird analysts as a “fresh pick” that is undervalued relative to peers.
    • Maintaining an Outperform rating with an $85 price target, Baird's Ben Kallo believes revenue visibility, with ~80% capacity contracted through 2020, will fortify FSLR from near-term module pricing pressure driven by Chinese regulation.
    • Kallo does not expect contract cancellations, which would result in forfeited down payments and potential penalties. and anticipates "minimal impact" from foreign policies given that FSLR has less than 3 GW of capacity left to sell through 2020.
    • Earlier: Solar industry headed for downturn after Chinese policy shift, Goldman says (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 63 Comments
  • AOCIF

    Auto dealership names higher on M&A buzz

    • There's some activity in the auto dealer sector after Clearwater Capital Management discloses that it pushed AutoCanada (OTC:AOCIF) to explore M&A options.
    • Shares of AutoCanada are up 5.9% in Toronto trading, while some sector names to watch in the U.S. include Sonic Automotive (SAH +4.4%), Rush Enterprises (RUSHB +2.4%), Cars.com (CARS +2.5%), Carvana (CVNA +2.1%), Copart (CPRT -0.3%), America's Car-Mart (CRMT -1%), Group 1 Automotive (GPI +1.5%) and Asbury Automotive Group (ABG +1.2%) .
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • INNT

    Innovate Bio -10% on Seeking Alpha aricle

    • "Innovate Biopharmaceuticals' (INNT -10.5%) pipeline of rejected drugs obtained at fire sale level prices, questionable SEC filings, and immediate need for capital suggest catastrophic failure is on the horizon," writes new Seeking Alpha contributor PD Research.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • XEC

    Cimarex Energy upgraded, Oasis Petroleum downgraded at Jefferies

    • Cimarex Energy (XEC +1.9%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $107 price target at Jefferies, which expects the company to enjoy improved longer-term production and to soon return more cash to shareholders via a dividend hike and/or a stock buyback program.
    • "Recent moves to address gas flow assurance in tandem with strategic partnerships in the Permian provide some level of relative safety on the company's ability to maintain capital guidance," Jefferies analyst Mark Lear writes.
    • The firm raises its Brent crude price forecast to $77 from $64 in 2018 and to $75 from $60 in 2019, while reiterating Buy ratings on Diamondback Energy (FANG +0.4%), Concho Resources (CXO +1.3%) and Callon Petroleum (CPE +0.2%).
    • At the same time, Jefferies downgrades Oasis Petroleum (OAS +0.8%) to Hold from Buy with a $14 price target on valuation after shares jumped 51% over the past three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • WFT

    Bloomberg: Weatherford weighing sale of its laboratories unit

    • Weatherford International (WFT -3.4%) is considering a sale of its laboratories business and has reached out to potential P-E and corporate buyers, Bloomberg reports.
    • A decision to sell the lab unit would coincide with CEO Mark McCollum’s plan to decrease debt and sell parts of the company including the onshore rig business.
    • WFT said in its Q1 earnings call in April that it had started two divestiture projects separate from its drilling rigs divestiture process, which it expected would generate ~$500M by the end of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • FCSC

    CRISPR/Cas9 gene editors weigh on gene therapy stocks

    • Most gene therapy stocks are in the red, led by the CRISPR/Cas9 players after two studies were published about the potential cancer risk related to edited cells.
    • Selected tickers: (FCSC -2.3%)(RCKT -4.7%)(ABEO -2.8%)(RGNX -3.1%)(BMRN -0.6%)(RARE -0.5%)(QURE -9.7%)(VYGR -6.3%)(BNTC -0.4%)(SGMO -5.5%)(ONCE -2.2%)(ADVM -0.4%)
    • Previously: CRISPR/Cas9 stocks under pressure on report of cancer risk with gene-editing technology (June 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 8 Comments
  • GEVO

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/11/2018)

    • Gainers: GEVO +21%. SNES +17%. PFIE +10%. LGCY +8%. LGCYO +8%.
    • Losers: ADNT -17%. GSV -10%. OTC:ANW -8%. YTEN -6%. CHNR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBGL

    Three more miners killed in latest Sibanye-Stillwater mine accident

    • Three gold miners are killed at a Sibanye-Stillwater (SBGL -5.2%) mine in South Africa while rescue teams search for two others.
    • SBGL says it is still investigating the incident, but five employees entered an abandoned working place at its Kloof Ikamva mine near Johannesburg.
    • At least 18 people have died at SBGL’s South African mines this year, including seven trapped underground at the Masakhane mine last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 8 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat chooses RingCentral for cloud solutions

    • Intelsat (I -6.5%) is going with RingCentral (RNG -0.3%) as the solutions provider for its cloud communications and collaboration.
    • The move will mean implementing RingCentral Office across North American and global locations.
    • That will bring device flexibility (between desk phones, softphones and mobiles), messaging and collaboration, integration with cloud apps and open APIs for customization.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast names two technical executives

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +4%) has made changes among its technical executives, tapping a new chief information officer and deputy chief technology officer.
    • Brian Bark is joining the company as VP and CIO, while Mike Kralec will take a new role as VP Technical Operation and deputy CTO.
    • Bark is the first CIO, with responsibility for IT vision and objectives as well as involvement in the company's digital strategy.
    • Kralec, meanwhile, was most recently the company's VP of Data Systems and Information Technology Services.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • SYK

    Sell-siders weigh in on possible Boston Scientific - Stryker marriage

    • Sell-side analysts see positives in the potential merger of Stryker (SYK -3.5%) and Boston Scientific (BSX +9.5%).
    • Wells Fargo's Larry Biegelsen: "Surprised" by the news. Wonders if BSX is a willing seller and if other suitors will emerge (e.g., Johnson & Johnson).
    • SunTrust's Bruce Nudell: On the surface, the deal makes strategic sense, combining SYK's hospital infrastructure with BSX's interventional implantable franchises.
    • Evercore's Vijay Kumar: The tie-up would create a "higher growth Medtronic," adding ~2% to SYK's 2019 EPS and ~6% in 2020.
    • Smith & Nephew (SNN -0.4%) initially sold off on the news, but has since recovered. The company has been a rumored acquisition target of Stryker.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Boston Scientific up 7% on rumored Stryker interest (June 11)
    • Previously: Rumor update: Stryker eyeing Smith & Nephew (Dec. 18, 2015)
    • Update: SYK and BSX shares halted pending news.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 5 Comments
  • GNW

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/11/2018)

    • Gainers: GNW +25%. XRF +10%. FUNC +8%. HGSH +8%. YRD +6%.
    • Losers: LYL -9%. OXBR -7%. KFS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • SGBAF

    Inmarsat still rising after naysaying EchoStar bid

    • Inmarsat (IMASY +6.8%) continues to move up in reaction to the company's rejection of a takeover bid from EchoStar (SATS -0.2%).
    • Over-the-counter shares rose 21% Friday after the news. They had jumped 13.5% in London trading.
    • Exane upgraded shares to Neutral with a price target of £5.50; that implies 16.1% upside from Friday's London close.
    • Meanwhile, RBC has noted the company's clearly in play for suitors following EchoStar's approach; along with private equity and mobile operators, other bidders could include ViaSat (VSAT -0.6%) or SES/Eutelsat (OTCPK:SGBAF +3.3%, OTCPK:EUTLY +3.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MLCO

    Gains in the Macau casino sector

    • There's solid gains in the Macau casino sector after several analysts come out with favorable notes.
    • Channel checks from Jefferies indicate Macau gross gaming revenue is trending toward a 15% gain in June, despite the World Cup headwind. Meanwhile, Nomura Instinet says its checks show "strong" underlying volume trends as anti-UnionPay crackdown efforts have had little impact.
    • Notable movers include Melco Resorts & Entertainment (NASDAQ:MLCO) +2.5%, MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) +2.2%, Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) +1.3%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) +1.1%. Earlier today in Hong Kong, Galaxy Entertainment (OTCPK:GXYEF, OTCPK:GXYEY, OTCPK:GXYYY) was up 1.7% and Wynn Macau (OTCPK:WYNMF, OTCPK:WYNMY) rose 2.4%.
    • Sources: South China Morning Post, Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 25 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD +2.7% as analyst, Intel CEO say it will take server chip market share

    • Nomura Instinet says AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) will likely take server chip market share away from Intel (NASDAQ:INTC).
    • Analyst Romit Shah cites a meeting last week with Intel CEO Brian Krzanich where he admitted Intel would lose server share to AMD in 2H. The analyst “thought it was interesting that Mr. Krzanich did not draw a firm line in the sand as it relates to AMD’s potential gains in servers; he only indicated that it was Intel’s job to not let AMD capture 15-20% market share.” 
    • AMD management has forecasted mid-single-digit server chip market share by the end of the year, up from an under 1% share last year. 
    • Intel has delayed volume production for its 10nm process to next year. AMD plans next-gen 7nm chip production later this year. 
    • Firm reiterates a Buy rating and $60 price target for Intel shares.
    • AMD shares are up 2.7% to $15.66. 
    • Intel shares are down 0.6% to $54.74.     
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 85 Comments
  • NNDM

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/11/2018)

    • Gainers: NNDM +134%. RFIL +33%. GNW +25%. LIVX +21%. SNES +19%. IGLD +20%. NFEC +18%. SRE +15%. EOLS +15%. XNET +15%.
    • Losers: VICL -27%. ADNT -17%. CRSP -14%. IBIO -12%. TPIV -12%. ATHX -11%. GSV -10%. RIGL -10%. OTCPK:MBVX -10%. KIDS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • NXST

    Nexstar shareholders reject advisory pay proposal

    • Nexstar Media Group (NXST +4.5%) shareholders have rejected their say-on-pay proposal at the company's annual meeting.
    • The company's SEC filing shows that Perry Sook, Geoff Armstrong and Jay Grossman were elected as Class III directors by heavy margins, and shareholders ratified the company's auditor.
    • But a nonbinding vote on executive compensation failed with 22.49M votes against, vs. a total of 15.23M for.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan's positive data on migraine prevention med atogepant pressures Alder Bio, down 4%

    • As is so often the case, good news for one biotech is bad for another. Allergan (AGN +1.1%) is in the green after reporting positive data on CGRP receptor antagonist atogepant for the prevention of migraine.
    • Alder Biopharmaceuticals (ALDR -3.5%) is in the red, albeit on below-average volume, as some investors react to the potential threat to lead candidate eptinezumab, a monoclonal antibody CGRP inhibitor in late-stage development for migraine prevention. A U.S. marketing application is on tap for early 2019.
    • Previously: Alder's eptinezumab shows treatment benefit in late-stage migraine study (April 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • BRX

    Two REITS upgraded, four cut at Evercore ISI, after REITWeek conference

    • Evercore ISI analyst Steve Sakwa raised Brixmor Property (BRX +1.7%) and Vornado (VNO +1.1%) and cut Brandywine Realty(BDN -0.5%), DDR (DDR +0.3%), Empire State Realty (ESRT -0.2%), and Host Hotels (HST -2.1%)after last week's REITWeek conference, Bloomberg reports.
    • In retail REITs, he raised BRX to outperform from in line and boosted his price target to $19 from $18. DDR cut to underperform from in line, though he increased his price target to $17 from $16: DDR's stock rose almost 12% last week and seems fairly valued, he wrote. NOI growth isn't likely to rebound to its earlier peak of 3%-4% for many retail REITs, he wrote, but estimates may "nudge higher" over next 18-30 months.
    • For office REITs, Sakwa raised VNO to outperform from in line with PT increased to $78 from $77. ESRT cut to in line from outperform with PT trimmed to $19 from $20; BDN to in line from outperform, and PT maintained at $19.
    • In lodging, HST downgraded to in line from outperform with PT kept at $23, due to recent outperformance.
    • Previously: Mall, shopping center REITs gain on surprisingly strong retail sales report (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 12 Comments
  • RCUS

    Arcus Bio advancing top candidates

    • Thinly traded Arcus Biosciences (RCUS -3.4%) is down on below-average volume, unable to hold its initial 3% gain.
    • This morning, the company announced that the FDA has signed off on its INDs for AB928 and AB122. It plans to launch a Phase 1/1b study assessing the safety, tolerability and initial efficacy of AP928, combined with other agents (including AB122), in patients with breast and gynecologic cancers.
    • It intends to file two additional INDs this month to clear the way for studies of AB928 in GI cancers, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and renal cell carcinoma (RCC). It also plans to evaluate the combination of AB928 and AB122 in an Australia-based study.
    • AB928 is an adenosine receptor antagonist. Adenosine, an immune system suppressor, is produced inside tumors in response to chemo or radiotherapy.
    • AB122 is an anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody (like Merck's Keytruda).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • NNDM

    Nano Dimension +133% on sale,

    • Nano Dimension (NASDAQ:NNDM) +133% on huge volume.
    • Company says it sold a DragonFly 2020 Pro 3D Printer to a U.S.-based, global top ten, defense company, the customer’s second purchase of a Nano Dimension 3D printed electronics system.
    • Company also says its U.S. subsidiary has achieved U.S. government Certified Vendor status.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIT

    Citron Research report sets Fitbit at 136% upside; FIT +6.5%

    • Citron Research is out with a report on Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) that calls it “one of the most underappreciated med-tech stories in the market.”
    • Citron expects Fitbit shares to hit $15 this year (a 136% upside to Friday’s close) if the company isn’t acquired first.
    • Fitbit shares are up 6.5% to $6.76. 
    • Previously: Fitbit +4.4% on launch of wearable for kids (June 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 87 Comments

  • PCG

    Analysts weigh in on PG&E liability issues with varying degrees of worry

    • PG&E (PCG -4.9%) is by far the weakest performer among major utilities after Cal Fire's investigation says its power lines and equipment caused 12 wildfires in northern California last October.
    • Wells Fargo sees the development as "incrementally negative" and thinks PCG shares reflect an "overly onerous outcome," but Edison International (EIX -0.7%) is the firm's preferred play for a California regulatory recovery; it rates PCG at Market Perform while trimming its price target to $46 from $48.
    • Citi reiterates its Neutral rating, saying the news increases the stock's downside risk while expressing surprise that Cal Fire is issuing press releases without listing any specific violations and without sharing the full reports.
    • A more optimistic Morgan Stanley rates PCG at Overweight, estimating the company is likely not liable for ~34% of damages reported to date and believing shareholders are unlikely to realize "anywhere close to 100% of both causation and negligence" for all 21 northern California wildfires; Deutsche Bank also reiterates a Buy rating on PCG.
    • But Guggenheim says "all signs seem to point" to PG&E "being imprudent operators in the majority of instances," which means the company should assume liability; it reaffirms its Sell rating on the shares, calling for potentially further downside, especially when the Tubbs investigation is released.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 4 Comments

    • Instagram is central to continued progress at Facebook (FB +1.6%), KeyBanc says, expecting it to contribute the bulk of incremental ad revenue just two years from now.

  • CRSP

    CRISPR/Cas9 stocks under pressure on report of cancer risk with gene-editing technology

    • CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP -11.4%), Editas Medicine (EDIT -7.2%) and Intellia Therapeutics (NTLA -6.6%) are all down on the heels of two studies published in Nature Medicine that appear to show the potential for cells edited by CRISPR/Cas9 to seed tumors inside a patient.
    • This is not the first time the stocks have sold off in response published research. In January, investors hit sale buttons (before recovering) in response to a study that questioned the viability of the cutting element, the Cas9 enzyme. In December 2017, the stocks sold off on a report that people's unique genetic differences could undermine the efficacy of the gene editing approach.
    • Previously: CRISPR/Cas9 gene-editing firms under pressure on paper questioning potential efficacy of cutting element (Jan. 8)
    • Previously: CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing players sell off, down as much as 4% (Dec. 12, 2017)
    • Update: In a statement to SA, an Intellia representative says the company has observed no signs of the potential effect noted in the research papers in either of its in vivo or ex vivo programs
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 55 Comments

  • GTBP

    GT Bio's OXS-1550 shows positive action in Phase 1/2 blood cancer study; shares up 17%

    • Preliminary results from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing GT Biopharma's (OTCQB:GTBP +17.3%) OXS-1550, a bispecific antibody-drug conjugate, in patients with treatment-resistant B-cell lymphomas (NHL) and leukemias (ALL) showed a treatment effect.
    • 54% (n=7/13) of patients experienced clinical benefit, including one complete responder, one partial responder and five with stable cancer.
    • In ALL patients, 75% (n=3/4) experienced clinical benefit (one complete responder, one partial responder and one with stable cancer).
    • Adverse events (AEs) were mostly mild or moderate. Three patients experienced grade 3 (serious) AEs (two with increased liver function tests, capillary leak) and one experienced a grade 4 (life-threatening) AE (low platelet count).
    • Final results should be available by year-end or early 2019.
    • OXS-1550 is a recombinant fusion protein-drug conjugate comprised of the variable regions of the heavy and light chains of CD19 and CD22 antibodies and a modified form of diptheria toxin, the cytotoxic payload.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM

  • OCC

    Optical Cable jumps 26.3% post Q2

    • Optical Cable (OCC +26.3%) reports Q2 revenue growth of 69.7% Y/Y to $26.9M.
    • Net sales to customers in the US increased 88.0% Y/Y & net sales to customers OUS decreased 4.3% Y/Y.
    • Q2 overall margins: Gross declined 240 bps to 33.3%, primarily due to changes in fiber optic cable product mix & Operating increased 756 bps to 5.79%.
    • SG&A expenses increased 25.5% Y/Y to $7.4M, the increase was due to the increases in employee related costs including employee incentives and commissions which increased due to increased net sales and the improved financial results in Q2.
    • "Our strategic focus is on sales and marketing initiatives in targeted markets to drive sales, as well as increasing operational efficiency.  We are optimistic that our success in both of these areas will positively impact our bottom line and enable us to deliver enhanced shareholder value." said Neil Wilkin, President and CEO.
